title: Firm sends cosmetics to poor women in North
content: While most donors send food to help impoverished North Koreans, a South Korean cosmetics company, Able C&C, said it delivered $451,000 (£238,000) worth of cosmetics, including shampoo, lipstick and eyeshadow, to the communist North in June. The Seoul-based company said it was considering further donations of makeup. "Since cosmetics are not luxury goods, but daily necessities, we thought North Koreans would really need them," it said in a statement. Famine in North Korea has killed about 2 million people, and foreign aid mostly comprises rice and fertiliser.
summary:
While most donors send food to help impoverished North Koreans, a South Korean cosmetics company, Able C&C, said it delivered $451,000 (£238,000) worth of cosmetics, including shampoo, lipstick and eyeshadow, to the communist North in June.
The Seoul-based company said it was considering further donations of makeup.
"Since cosmetics are not luxury goods, but daily necessities, we thought North Koreans would really need them," it said in a statement.
Famine in North Korea has killed about 2 million people, and foreign aid mostly comprises rice and fertiliser.
